comments.author: Shawn Heisey
comments.content:
Does the browser URL for the admin UI contain /#/ or /indexhtml# when this happens?

Are you in a position where you can upgrade to 5.3.1 to see if it's still a problem?

I'm somewhat mystified by an entire response (in XML format, no less) being part of the request, even in the stream.body parameter.

comments.author: Shawn Heisey
comments.content:
Ah!  With some poking, I figured out why the response is in the request.  When using the "diff=true" parameter, it expects a reponse for comparison to be in the stream.body parameter.

I think part of the problem here might be that the XML in the request is not URI encoded.  On a 5.2.1 server, when I do the "watch changes" thing, I see a request where stream.body starts out like this – notice that all the less than and greater than symbols which are prominent in XML are encoded as %nn values:

stream.body=%3C%3Fxml+version%3D%221.0%22+encoding%3D%22UTF-8%22%3F%3E%0A%3Cresponse%3E%

This might be a bug in the 5.1 version that is fixed in later versions.  I am completely guessing here.

comments.author: Yurii Kartsev
comments.content:
Thanks for your answers, Shawn. For exact links please see below.

Unfortunately I can't update to the latest version just yet. Although this issue is not critical.

Also I can tell that I see it sporadically, i.e. some times it's there, sometimes it's not. For example, the following actions caused NPE at first, but when I repeated them, there was no NPE:


	Go to "http://localhost:8983/solr/#/my-search/plugins/cache" and click "Refresh Values", then click "Watch Changes"
	In other tab open "http://localhost:8983/solr/#/my-search/query" and query (25359) for a field (in my case it has ngrams tokenizer) + having one filter query: "http://localhost:8983/solr/my-search/select?q=recordId%3A25359&fq=specialCode%3A7&wt=json&indent=true"
	Query for the same field, but different value 2535 (in my case it has ngrams tokenizer) + having one filter query: "http://localhost:8983/solr/my-search/select?q= recordId%3A2535&fq=specialCode%3A7&wt=json&indent=true"
	Index some new records from java code (in my case).
	Query for the same field, but different value 253 (in my case it has ngrams tokenizer) + having one filter query: "http://localhost:8983/solr/my-search/select?q= recordId%3A253&fq=specialCode%3A7&wt=json&indent=true"
	Query for the same field, but different value 25 (in my case it has ngrams tokenizer) + having one filter query: "http://localhost:8983/solr/my-search/select?q= recordId%3A25&fq=specialCode%3A7&wt=json&indent=true"
	Go to the first tab and click "Stop & Show Changes". Observe no changes, see NPE in the log:

comments.author: Shawn Heisey
comments.content:
I think this is probably a bug that has already been fixed in 5.2 and later.

My best guess is that one of our devs noticed a lack of URL encoding in the "watch changes" code and fixed it between the 5.1 and 5.2 releases, without opening an issue specifically for the problem.  I've been searching my archive of commit messages and haven't found it, but I suspect that I just don't know what to use for the query.
